Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of woman with basket on head. Head broken from a figure of a kanephoros: a woman with wavy hair, which is parted in the middle with locks falling towards her shoulder, and who wears a narrow fillet. Her right hand survives to support a tall cylindrical basket on top of her head; incuse details of the basket are well shown. The back is plain. Hollow, from two-piece mould, with traces of paint: orange-pink on her hair and hand; cream and pink on the basket. Brown Nile silt, with abundant fine gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Close parallel was purchased at Memphis by Petrie (Petrie et al. 1910, pl. 44, 163). Petrie, W. M. F. MacKay, E and Wainwright, G. 1910. Memphis, vol III: Meydum and Memphis. London.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (C595)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.350) (Phase 1)
